definition: to be deadlocked
rigid/deadlock/stiff (corpse)
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control
nuclear equipoise/nuclear stalemate

sentences.english: Due to the problem of nuclear item,Iran deadlock with west countries all long.
sentences.chinese: 由於核項目問題，伊朗一直跟西方國家僵持不下。

sentences.english: The result is a global standoff.
A standoff plate is mounted to an exterior side of the header plate.
sentences.chinese: 僵持板安裝在一個頭板外側。

sentences.english: The war situation has been stalemated.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭局勢陷入了僵持階段。

sentences.english: But gridlock as a political strategy is destructive to the country.
sentences.chinese: 但將這種僵持作爲一種政治策略是對國家的傷害。

sentences.english: I cannot hold on studying without someonenos encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 沒有佐理，我就僵持不住了。

sentences.english: A police standoff ensued, and ended only when the suspect shot himself.
sentences.chinese: 一名警察隨後與歹徒僵持，直至該嫌犯吞槍自殺。

sentences.english: Both sides stalemate, and his lap.
sentences.chinese: 並且，雙方僵持，各不相讓。

sentences.english: The situation was deadlocked; the planet doomed.
sentences.chinese: 僵持局面出現了，地球末日來到了。

sentences.english: But holding out may force Ballmer to up the ante.
sentences.chinese: 但是，繼續僵持恐怕會迫使鮑爾默提高賭注。

sentences.english: China is committed to the path of peaceful development.
sentences.chinese: 中國將僵持走和平發展門路。

sentences.english: Pursue your object, this what it will, steofferily very goodd indefatigably.
sentences.chinese: 不管追求什麼目標，都應僵持不懈。

definition: to stand opposite/to confront/confrontation
locked in a stalemate/to confront one another
to-and-fro tussle/closely-fought contest
impasse/deadlock
to stick onto/stalemate/gridlock/to agglutinate
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
a two-man saw/fig. to-and-fro between two sides
evenly matched (idiom)
chaotic warfare/confused fighting/melee/to join in such fighting
aspect/phase/situation
both sides (in contract)/the two opposing sides (in a dispute)
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
neither giving way to the other
situation/state (of affairs)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to become caught up in an irresolvable situation (idiom)
